course_name: Exercise Prescription & Programming for Cardiorespiratory Disease
description:
To develop theoretical and practical skills for physical activity assessment, prescription and programming for individuals with, or at risk of, cardiovascular or pulmonary disease. To provide students with the skills necessary to interpret an ECG. Interpretation, understanding and evaluation of normal and abnormal rate, rhythm and 12 lead ECGs. Supervised clinical fieldwork will be required.
This course had the previous code of HMST4742 which can be viewed in the archived area within the Course and Program site http://www.uq.edu.au/study/archive/index.html
